perturbation.original_text: This agreement shall remain in full force and effect until revoked by any party hereto in a signed writing provided to each other party hereto, and then only with respect to such revoking party.
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement shall remain in full force and effect, except that any party can revoke with only verbal notice to the other party, and then only with respect to such revoking party.
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces ambiguity by suggesting that revocation can occur with 'verbal notice,' contradicting the original requirement of 'signed writing.' This undermines the enforceability of the revocation clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Requirement of Written Notice

perturbation.original_text: Pursuant to and in accordance with the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), and the rules and regulations thereunder, each party hereto hereby agrees to the joint filing, on behalf of each of them, of any filing required by such party under Section 13 or Section 16 of the Exchange Act or any rule or regulation thereunder (including any amendment, restatement, supplement, and/or exhibit thereto) with the Securities and Exchange Commission (and, if such security is registered on a national securities exchange, also with the exchange), and further agrees to the filing, furnishing, and/or incorporation by reference of this agreement as an exhibit thereto.
perturbation.changed_text: Pursuant to and generally in accordance with the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), and the rules and regulations thereunder, each party hereto hereby agrees to the joint filing, on behalf of each of them, of any filing required by such party under Section 13 or Section 16 of the Exchange Act or any rule or regulation thereunder (including any amendment, restatement, supplement, and/or exhibit thereto) with the Securities and Exchange Commission (and, if such security is registered on a national securities exchange, also with the exchange), and further agrees to the filing, furnishing, and/or incorporation by reference of this agreement as an exhibit thereto. However, this is not legally binding.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of "However, this is not legally binding" introduces a contradiction by nullifying the agreement to comply with the Securities Exchange Act. The initial part establishes a commitment to joint filings, but the added clause effectively renders the entire agreement unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934, Section 13 and 16
